CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 2, 1955, pg. 5 reads: "Finish Police Course - Monday evening, Pittsburgh Academy Certificates of Attainment were awarded forty students who successfully completed the course of "Basic Correctional Training," out of a total enrollment of eighty-seven. The course was designed to provide an in-service training program for people who are actively engaged in the criminal justice program of the Commonwealth.  Members of the Pittsburgh Police Department of all ranks participated as students.  Among them were, left to right, Patrolmen Charles L. Robinson, William H. Grayson Jr., Edward Bailey, Superintendent of Police James W. Slusser, Fred H. Miller, adviser, Public Service Institute, Harrisburg; Traffic Patrolman Robert L. Rucker, Patrolman Leo A. Anderson, Traffic Patrolman Joseph G. Moss, and Robert A. Itri, assistant district supervisor, Pennsylvania Board of Parole, Pittsburgh. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Police Department members, from left: Charles L. Robinson, William H. Grayson Jr., Edward Bailey, James W. Slusser, Fred H. Miller, Robert L. Rucker, Leo A. Anderson, Traffic Patrolman Joseph G. Moss, and Robert A. Itri, standing in interior with Old Shay Beer clock celebrating course completion
